result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel O Bourdo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

No violent contact with victim.
No alcohol. No drugs or drug paraphernalia.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel O Bourdo

records.addlTxt: Application for Jail Time Credit form

2:46 PM Defendant Daniel O Bourdo appeared by video.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Daniel O Bourdo. 
Defendant is waiving his right to appear in person.
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to count 1.
Court has a colloquy with defendant.
Court gives WARNINGS regarding deportation, felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29 and  ineligibility to vote until civil rights restored.
Selmek believes plea to be made freely, knowingly, and voluntarily.
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. 
Both sides request Court adopt agreement.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement.
Court will adopt agreement.

WITHHELD SENTENCE, defendant placed on Probation for a period of three (3) years.  Probation to be concurrent to other cases.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

Pay costs, including supervision fees.
Pay restitution, if any is claimed.
Complete AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended counseling.
Complete any counseling as recommended by agent.
No violent contact with victim.
No weapons.
No alcohol.
No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Seventy (70) days dead time credit, if probation is revoked.
State's Brief in Support of Motion to Join
Motion to Join
Amended cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

BOND TO COVER 22CF183, 22CM147, 21CM616 & 21CM649

*AMENDMENT 5-11-2022: DEFENDANT MAY HAVE CONTACT WITH D.E.S.

**AMENDED ON APRIL 4, 2022:  DEFENDANT MAY HAVE CONTACT WITH D.E.S. WHILE INCARCERATED
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.E.S. OR CO-ACTOR JASON TROY. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel O Bourdo in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner for Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Daniel O Bourdo. Motion to modify bond by defense. Argument, granted. State objects to modification. Future dates remain as scheduled. Minutes filed.
Defense Bond Motion

Defendant Daniel O Bourdo appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford.  Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Daniel O Bourdo. Called @ 1:22 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for arraignment on 22CF183; AIA on 22cm147, and status on 21CM616 & 21CM649. Record by Atty. Selmek who enters not guilty pleas on behalf of the defendant on both 22CF183 and 22CM147. Further record by Atty. Selmek as to motion to modify bond. Argument by Atty. Crawford as to State's objection. No victims are present in Court. Based upon record, Court denies motion to modify bond. Atty. Selmek demands speedy trial. Matter set for Speedy trial as requested. Parties have nothing further. Court in recess.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

3:01 PM Defendant Daniel O Bourdo in court, in custody via video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Andrew Herrmann in court.  Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Daniel O Bourdo. 
State called to the stand as a witness Brad Cheske.
Brad Cheske duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination of ADA Herrmann. Victim identified the defendant on the video. Exhibit #1, marked, identified and discussed.
3:03 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Selmek.
Exhibit #1 offered and received by the Court.
3:07 PM - Argument by ADA Herrmann.
3:08 PM - Withholds argument. Requesting defendant not be bound over.

State requests couple of weeks for Arraignment Hearing.
adj. 3;09 PM
Arraignment scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

DEFENDANT MAY HAVE CONTACT WITH D.E.S. WHILE INCARCERATED

Defendant Daniel O Bourdo appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford.  Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Daniel O Bourdo. Called @ 1:47 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on 22CF183 with other matters tracking - 21CM616, 21CM649, 22CM147. Court addresses stipulation to amend bond to allow for contact while the defendant is incarcerated - request granted. Further record by Atty. Selmek who requests that the initial appearance be set over so she can go over charges/penalties with the defendant. Court grants request and sets all matters over to next date.
Initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
